Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention Hearings as to Ricardo Camacho (5) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 2/27/2015. SAUSA Maria Montanez and defense counsel Raymond Rivera were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, the Government is seeking detention. Defense counsel had no evidence to rebut the presumption, but reserved the right to reopen the matter of bail. Reservation was noted  by the Court. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:26. Hearing ended at 03:00. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (br) (Entered: 03/03/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention Hearings as to John John Maldonado-Paneto (6) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 2/27/2015. SAUSA Maria Montanez and defense counsel Benito Rodriguez were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, defense counsel agreed with the pretrial recommendation for bail, defendant's parents are willing to post their property as collateral for bail and will comply with any release conditions imposed. The Government proffered defendant's role and or participation as an enforcer, this is a presumption case and moved for detention. The Court finds that defendant did not rebut the presumption and ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial based on the role and nature of the offense, prior arrest records and that defendant was not forthcoming to the probation officer as to the use and abuse problem. If after receiving discovery, counsel may reopen the matter of bail. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:26. Hearing ended at 03:00. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (br) (Entered: 03/03/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention Hearings as to Wilson R. Santiago-Bracero (14) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 2/27/2015. SAUSA Maria Montanez and defense counsel Luis Guzman were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, defense counsel informed that defendant is not seeking bail. The Government agreed to the pretrial recommendation for bail, but if defendant is seeking detention, then the Government will move for detention. The Court granted additional time for counsel and his client to discuss the matter. After a brief recess, defense counsel reiterated his request to remain detained. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:26. Hearing ended at 03:00. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (br) (Entered: 03/03/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention Hearings as to Juan Ramon Flores-Colon (20) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 2/27/2015. SAUSA Maria Montanez and defense counsel Lillian N. Miranda were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, the Government is moving for detention. Defense counsel had no evidence to rebut the presumption, but reserved the right to reopen the matter of bail. Reservation was noted by the Court. The Court ordered defendant detained wihtout bail pending trial due to history of convictions, substance abuse problem and that conditions of release can not be crafted. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:26. Hearing ended at 03:00. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (br) (Entered: 03/03/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention Hearings as to Adela Paneto-Soto (21) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 2/27/2015. SAUSA Maria Montanez and defense counsel Carmen L. Soto were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, the Government proffered defendant's role and/or participation as a seller, agreed with the pretrial recommendation for detention and moved for detention. Defendant's son, also indicted as #1 Jose L. Colon-Paneto, remains a fugitive. Defense counsel proffered defendant's serious physical health condition, that relatives were in court and willing to accept her in their home. The Court finds that, based on defendant's history of substance abuse, the many runnings with the law, the lengthy criminal history and the special status within  the organization, there are no conditions for release at this time. If and when defendant's son and any other co-defendants are arrested, counsel may reopen the matter of bail and proffer for defendant not to get near the public housing project, reside with relatives, receive medical care, then the Court may be willing to reconsider. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:26. Hearing ended at 03:00. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (br) (Entered: 03/03/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention Hearings as to Alexis Javier Aponte-Negron (24) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 2/27/2015. SAUSA Maria Montanez and defense counsel Eduardo Ferrer were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, defense counsel informed that defendant is not seeking bail and will not contest to the pretrial recommendation. The Government moved for detention and proffered the role of the defendant as a seller. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:26. Hearing ended at 03:00. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (br) (Entered: 03/03/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention Hearings as to Jose A. Colon-Paneto (2) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 3/2/2015. SAUSA Maria Montanez and defense counsel Raul Mariani (arrived at 10:40 AM) were present. Counsel apologized for being tardy, since he was before Judge Besosa in another hearing. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to Julio Alberto Millan-Irizarry (9) Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 held on March 25, 2015. Present were AUSA Maria L. Montanez-Concepcion, and court appointed counsel Wilfredo Rios-Mendez. The defendant was present in court, under custody, and was assisted by the official court interpreter. Arraignment held. The defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings, and waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts of the Indictment. The United States was granted seven (7) days to provide discovery, and the defendant was granted fourteen (14) days thereafter for the filing of dispositive motions. Case referred to Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for pretrial and jury trial. As to Detention, counsel for the defendant argued in favor that bail be imposed. The United States made a proffer as to defendant's role and participation in this case and requested the defendant shall remain detained without bail. The Court after hearing the parties, ordered that the defendant shall remain detained without bail on the basis of risk of flight and danger to community. NOTE to counsel for the defendant: Order issued at docket no. 87. Status Conference set for ALL DEFENDANTS for March 30, 2015 10:00 a.m. before the Presiding Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll:  Motion Hearing as to John John Maldonado-Paneto (6) held on 7/24/2015, re: 180 Motion for DeNovo Bail Hearing. AUSA Maria Montanez and defense counsel Benito Rodriguez were present. Defense counsel moved to reopen the matter of bail and proffered that defendant will secure employment upon release and will comply with any other strict conditions imposed by the Court. If the government's witness were to testify, the Government proffered the role and/or participation as an enforcer in the case. Defendant is related to co-defendant #1 who is still a fugitive. After listening to the parties, the Court finds that this is a presumption case, that there is a first degree murder charge, that defendant is a substance user and is related to co-defendant #1, who is still a fugitive. Based on these factors and concern as to danger, the Court ordered that defendant remain detained without bail pending trial. Defense counsel informed as to defendant's health condition of Chron's Disease which is being attended at MDC at a very slow pace when it should be taken care actively. Family members are willing to pay the difference that the medical plan does not cover for defendant to receive all his medications. The Court is willing to follow-up with the medical situation. However, if counsel does not see any improvement, the Court may issue a show cause order to the medical warden. Minutes will be sent to MDC. (MDC by e-mail.) (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:30. Hearing held at 10:06. Hearing ended at 10:17. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (br) (Entered: 07/29/2015)

Defendant stated that his last name is SANTANA. Defendant's true name is Prett O'Nell Santana- Torres. The parties were instructed to correct defendant's name and initial the same in all the documents. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. Waiver of Trial by Jury and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. He was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi so that the guilty plea as to count one (1) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Defendant shall remain under custody. Sentencing Hearing is set for 8/22/2016 at 9:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Gustavo A. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail as to Jose L. Colon-Paneto (1) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 5/4/2016. Present: AUSA Maria Montanez, counsel for defendant Jose Aguayo and USPO Emmanuel Bravo. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by the court Interpreter. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts of the Indictment. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for further proceedings. As to bail, the Government moved for detention. Defense counsel argued in favor of bail. After hearing the patries, the Court ordered defendant detained pending further procedings. Order to issue. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 9:15 am. Hearing held at 9:33 am. Hearing ended at 9:39 am. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (cmd) (Entered: 05/04/2016)

Present were AUSA Maria Montanez, defense counsel Francisco Adams and USPO Emmanuel Bravo. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts of the Indictment. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for further proceedings. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Christian Xavier Torres-Rivera (13) held on 10/31/2016. Present were AUSA Maria Montanez and defense counsel Javier Cuyar. Defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant was found competent to plea. The defendant was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Gustavo A. Gelpi, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to counts one (1) and six (6) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Defense counsel requested that the defendant remains at MDC to be able to face revocation proceedings in state court. The Court recommends MDC to keep defendant in this jurisdiction for 90 days for him to face revocation proceedings at state level, attend his interview for the pre-sentence report and be sentenced by the presiding judge in this case. Sentencing Hearing is set for 1/30/2017 at 9:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 9:30 am. Hearing held at 10:15 am. Hearing ended at 10:37 am. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (cmd) (Entered: 10/31/2016)

Present were AUSA Denisse Longo, Attorney Carlos Beck and USPO Martin De Santiago. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. ORDER as to Ricardo Camacho (5): Given the exigent circumstances generated by the COVID-19 Pandemic, and while considering the related and relevant dispositions within the MDC-Guaynabo and USMS protocols and consistent with the Order issued by the undersigned pursuant to the Cares Act (See 20-mc-088), the Court finds that the only viable mechanism in which it may currently conduct a change of plea hearing is by Video Conference. This will ensure public health and safety and also afford for the proceedings to be conducted without further delay. The mechanisms herein implemented are in the best interests of justice and the parties. Therefore, the Motion for Change of Plea is referred to Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan for setting of Rule 11 Hearing and submission of Report and Recommendation. Hearing shall be set in accordance to the calendar availability of the Magistrate Judge. Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi on 8/4/2020.(gmm) (Entered: 08/04/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Change of Plea Hearing as to Ricardo Camacho (5) held on 8/19/2020. Present: AUSA Corinne Cordero (for Maria Montanez) and defense counsel Raymond Rivera. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Consent to be Present at COP Hearing via VTC, filed by the defense at Docket No. 1075 , was noted. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceeding by way of VTC. Waiver of JT and Consent to Proceed before USMS was filed and accepted. The defendant was found competent to plead. The defendant was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After having heard the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to U.S. District Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi so that the guilty plea as to Counts One (1) and Six (6) of the Indictment be accepted. PSR was ordered. The defendant shall remain detained pending sentencing. Sentencing Hearing set for 11/17/2020 09:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi.
